parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) a door, (b) met: an opportunity. Apparently a primary word; a portal or entrance.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To knock, beat a door with a stick, to gain admittance. Apparently a primary verb; to rap.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) a door, (b) met: an opportunity. Apparently a primary word; a portal or entrance.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To dine, sup, eat. From deipnon; to dine, i.e. Take the principle meal.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.
